body:
<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* [#16362](https://drahtbot.github.io/bitcoin_core_issue_redirect/r/16362.html) (gui: Bilingual translation by hebasto)
* [#15606](https://drahtbot.github.io/bitcoin_core_issue_redirect/r/15606.html) ([experimental] UTXO snapshots by jamesob)
* [#9384](https://drahtbot.github.io/bitcoin_core_issue_redirect/r/9384.html) (CCoinsViewCache code cleanup & deduplication by ryanofsky)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.
Took @MarcoFalke's patch and rebased. Thanks, Marco.
Had to revert part of Marco's patch (see https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/16355#discussion_r301265342).

ACK 30de23d743ca3d9b3335061bccf6cf8ab30a8b79, mostly move-only

moving CCoinsViewErrorCatcher out of init makes sense, so that e.g. a chainstate
constructor can be written and called by unit tests.

utACK. Could you fix up Rus's nit and this should be mergeable.
Thanks for the reviews and nudge. Pushed.
This is only used in the cpp file, no?

diff_hunk:
@@ -315,4 +317,28 @@ void AddCoins(CCoinsViewCache& cache, const CTransaction& tx, int nHeight, bool
 //! lookups to database, so it should be used with care.
 const Coin& AccessByTxid(const CCoinsViewCache& cache, const uint256& txid);
 
+/**
+ * This is a minimally invasive approach to shutdown on LevelDB read errors from the
+ * chainstate, while keeping user interface out of the common library, which is shared
+ * between bitcoind, and bitcoin-qt and non-server tools.
+ *
+ * Writes do not need similar protection, as failure to write is handled by the caller.
+*/
+class CCoinsViewErrorCatcher final : public CCoinsViewBacked
+{
+public:
+    typedef std::function<void()> Function;
body: Any reason for not inlining this trivial typdef?
Yup - vestige from previous version where function defs were inlined to header. Thanks.

diff_hunk:
@@ -315,4 +317,28 @@ void AddCoins(CCoinsViewCache& cache, const CTransaction& tx, int nHeight, bool
 //! lookups to database, so it should be used with care.
 const Coin& AccessByTxid(const CCoinsViewCache& cache, const uint256& txid);
 
+/**
+ * This is a minimally invasive approach to shutdown on LevelDB read errors from the
+ * chainstate, while keeping user interface out of the common library, which is shared
+ * between bitcoind, and bitcoin-qt and non-server tools.
+ *
+ * Writes do not need similar protection, as failure to write is handled by the caller.
+*/
+class CCoinsViewErrorCatcher final : public CCoinsViewBacked
+{
+public:
+    typedef std::function<void()> Function;

body: Ah oops, just realizing that we can't do this. In a [later version](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/15606/commits/91284964ef34b90ee6c626137973d2c15e7b25da#diff-349fbb003d5ae550a2e8fa658e475880R523), the coinscatcher is constructed in a place where `uiInterface` (and qt) isn't known, so we actually need to specify the callback after construction.
Should drop `const`, otherwise std::move below can't really have any effect.
